website_summaries.verdict: A minimalist design for those who like to feel the trail beneath their feet.
pros: Flexible sole offers protection while letting you feel the ground
Extremely comfortable for those who like a minimalist shoe
cons: Durability of the mesh has been an issue for a few users

website_summaries.verdict: A barefoot-style trail running shoe that comes in four styles.
pros: The trail glove features an extremely grippy outsole, which helps instill confidence on uncertain terrain
Easy to clean and lightweight in addition to providing a smooth, natural transition from heel to toe
The shoe is also a good choice for cycling
cons: Almost too much ground feel with these

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I've had these shoes for exactly 3 months and they are already getting holes in the mesh. I wear these daily but am not hard on them so I am very disappointed in the quality of these shoes. I expect a pair of shoes to last around a year when they cost $90+. I really like the way they look and how minimal they are but I can't drop $90 every few months on replacements.
customer_reviews.author: J. bohanan

customer_reviews.title: merrell historically makes a great, reasonably price product
customer_reviews.text: i realize this is a flat lasted shoe and bought them specifically for light weight and contour. however, the shoe is less than month old - maybe i've worn in a dozen times for 3-5 mile walks - and already it's ripping at seam on both toes. the shoe is poorly made. merrell historically makes a great, reasonably price product. however, this shoe - mine - is cheaply made and at nearly 100 bucks, that's messed up!
customer_reviews.author: katieb

customer_reviews.title: Awesome !!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great buy for me. It fits great! The minimalist type of shoes are the only ones that are comfortable for me. I ran with this shoes and it felt great, no arch pains. I cannot wear the traditional shoes with thick soles. I also love the color. This shoes is an alternative to my Five Finger Vibram shoes.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Poor longevity
customer_reviews.text: I love the fit and comfort of this shoe. However, the sole is exceedingly thin and I have holes in both soles after just over 3 months of use. I use them for about 45 min of daily dog walking. No running and no trails. I bought these after having a different pair of Merrells that lasted several years.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Creating Better Balance
customer_reviews.text: I like this shoe so much that I anticipate buying another pair, or two. Keeps my feet and toes flexible and eventually stronger, adding to strong muscles in the legs and so better balance.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: I love using these for non-Olympic weightlifting and for running
customer_reviews.text: I love using these for non-Olympic weightlifting and for running. Actually, I also used them for climbing in Acadia National Park. They’ve held up great. I’m flat footed and have wide feet and these fit well and helped strengthen my arches. There is an adjustment period though, I started out only doing some cardio or .5 mile runs in them because they work muscles that aren’t used to it. It took me ages to be able to jump rope in them without getting awful calf cramps, but it was worth powering through. If you Crossfit though avoid these for rope climbs- no grip and the rope is like soap against them. It tears through the fabric too :(
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett

customer_reviews.title: I want more.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes in November 2017 in spite of the comments about fabric wearing out quickly. After over a year of almost daily wear these are still holding up well with only a hint of fraying at the edge of the rubberized reinforcement area. I want more and wish they came in more colors.
customer_reviews.author: jgr1089

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this shoe. It has a surprisingly good amount of arch support and feels very natural on my foot. The sole is sturdy and prevents me from feeling the rocks on unpaved roads and nature trails, but is so well contoured to my natural foot shape that it still feels almost like I'm wearing socks-- super comfortable, lightweight, protective socks. These have quickly become my favorite new shoes for running, hiking, around the house...everywhere, really. I ordered my true size and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: These are the greatest shoes -- and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: These are the greatest shoes -- and long lasting! I recently replaced my old Merrell Glove shoes for these (those lasted over 2 years of heavy wear -- hopefully these do the same!) They fit exactly as expected. I wear a 9, and these were perfect. They are slightly narrow, but have a great stretch if you have wider feet. The best thing about these is that they have virtually NO arch support. If you're looking for arch support or padding on the bottom of your shoe, don't go with these.
customer_reviews.author: Arianna A.

customer_reviews.title: I love the comfort
customer_reviews.text: On my first order I got the size wrong. I ordered 1 1/2 size larger for running like I do as recommended by the running stores here. That size was waay too big so I returned and ordered my actual size. This size fits but still felt too roomy or too wide as compared with the lace-up snug fit at the ball of my foot that I'm use to from traditional commercialized running shoes. I've worn my Merrell's to the gym and on errands and I like this relax feel so much now that I'm looking to purchase again. I haven't ran in them yet but I sure like what Ive experienced so far.
customer_reviews.author: MarshaRenee

customer_reviews.title: Great for weight training,  horrible for any cardio!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love these. They are super lightweight, but slightly stiff and won’t work well for my excercise class. We do a fair bit of running and jumping between squats and weights. While these shoes would be perfect for squats and weights, there is absolutely no cushion! I bought Reebok CrossFit that are much more comfortable. While wish they had the zero drop of these Merrill’s, the comfort, stretchy laces, and traditional eye holes are much better for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: BaileysMom

customer_reviews.title: Love this shoe, hate the color shift towards green.
customer_reviews.text: I like this shoe and buy it because I.can feel the ground while wearing it. I am not looking for support, I very much want to feel the ground! I noticed, though, that this time the shoe is more green than black, which disappoints me. Just because I am female does NOT MEAN I AM SCARED OF BLACK SHOES!!!! I would greatly prefer this shoe in solid black and am frustrated by the fact that shoe manufacturers seem to think that being a woman means I want a non-black shoe. I hope the manufacturer listens and returns this shoe to its greyer former color, or better yet offers a dead black version of this.
customer_reviews.author: SunnyDaze

customer_reviews.title: A Great First Barefoot Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Shoes were comfortable right out of the box! These are my first barefoot shoes, and I fell in love with them immediately. I hiked about 15 miles this past weekend with my new shoes, and felt more sure-footed than I ever have on the trails - rocky terrain, gravel hills, etc. Surprisingly, my feet were not at all tired feeling. I'm sold! I almost always wear size 8.5, and these shoes in an 8.5 fit just perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Burton

customer_reviews.title: Take some getting used to
customer_reviews.text: I love these merrells and they became very hard to find. I wore them longer than I should have before I eventually had to replace them due to wear. The minimalist shoes went out of fashion, I think because people don't give themselves long enough to adapt to them and end up getting injured. You have to adjust your stride and will build up some calf muscles. Take it slow if you get shoes like these. I now have Altra's which have more structure but I think are also great shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Ollie G

customer_reviews.title: A poor replacement for the shoes I came to love!
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite disappointed in these shoes. I ordered them as a replacement for the SAME shoe that I've been wearing for perhaps 4 years, and figured new ones would have better tread. I ordered the SAME SIZE as my original "barefoot shoe", but this shoe is weirdly wider in the toe box, and is longer in length...to the point that I hope I don't trip. If I move my foot forward in the shoe, it's better in the front, but loose in the heel area. If anyone at Merrell is reading this, may I return them for a refund? :(
customer_reviews.author: Bev Krouse

customer_reviews.title: Different Merrells.  Painful Merrells.
customer_reviews.text: I've sworn by Merrell barefoot shoes for a decade. Every pair I've ever owned has lasted for years, conformed to my needs and comfort level with their first wear. EXCEPT FOR THESE. Three months in, there is a hole forming in the material on the top of the shoe and they are so uncomfortable that I am now finding myself shoe shopping again for my 3-mile/day hikes and road running. These shoes are definitely of lower quality materials and the design of the sole interior causes excessive heel discomfort. The sizing seems different, as well: I have always worn a size 8 in this brand, but these feel too small in all of the wrong places.
customer_reviews.author: Amy D

customer_reviews.title: The Castle Rock color is more turquoise than the black and grey that’s pictured.
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. These are my third pair. I was excited to have a pair of Merrells that are close to being all black and grey so that they go with more. I ordered the darker option, “Castle Rock.” It turns out they’re more green and turquoise with black... not black and grey like in the picture. I have an upcoming Peru trip this week so I probably won’t return them and just make do with the color.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Love them even more going up a size!
customer_reviews.text: As these are my 4th or 5th pair of Merrell Gloves, I'm a fan. My sizing fluctuates between 9.5-10, and all my others have been 9.5, but I realized how much effort I put into putting these shoes on and tried going up a size. They still fit well, and I can wear any of my socks. My only negative is that they have a knitted body to them. It appeared they had a solid body like the original ones I have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: God I love these, although I personally can't wear them without ...
customer_reviews.text: God I love these, although I personally can't wear them without the heel support of Superfeet Berry. Merrill made the next iteration a half size smaller, which drives me wild because I can just barely manage to fit my endlessly long feet into these. I have high arches and I love how you can get these sneaks to hug your arches. Your feet feel completely supported. The front bumper (as it were) is really helpful and durable for those frequent times when you trip over a root or branch on a trail. I wouldn't wear these on asphalt, but maybe people do. (?)
customer_reviews.author: New England Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Exercise your feet
customer_reviews.text: I love this shoe! I wear it a lot for errands, exercise classes, dog walks, etc. It may not be for everyone, but I feel more secure being able to feel the ground and having more flexibility than I have with other athletic shoes. I’m 70 and have a lift in one shoe, so I’m probably not the usual buyer. I have read recently that keeping the nerves in feet functioning is important and going barefoot is one way to do that, but this shoe protects from sharp objects, wet places, etc while letting your feet be stimulated.
customer_reviews.author: AZ RVer

customer_reviews.title: they are nice and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I wear these for foam combat sports, they are nice and lightweight. The closest thing to barefoot without being actually barefoot. Thus far they have survived the desert heat, and hours of fighting on grass and dirt surfaces. It's worth noting that while I was worried about the arch support in these shoes, the way they are woven for some reason gives a little support to the arch. Nice and comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Miller

customer_reviews.title: Superbly comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable shoes I've ever owned. 1. They weigh next to nothing. 2. Nothing pinches. 3. Nothing rubs. Most shoes I've owned feel comfortable enough, but I always feel good taking them off at the end of the day. With these, I get home and choose to leave them on. I mostly use them for walking during the work week, but they're my first choice all weekend long. I usually wear between and 8 and 8 1/2, and the larger size is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Library Chick

customer_reviews.title: Happy Feet!
customer_reviews.text: What a surprise! I've been searching for, and have spent alot if money in a quest for minimal shoes. I tried these due to the reviews. I wasn't expecting much, especially for the reasonable price. But when I put them on I was surprised. I think my feet starting laughing because they felt soooo good! They really do fit like a glove but are light weight and not impeding movement. I'll wear them for a few hours today and see how it goes, but these shoes, out of the box, make my whole body feel great! Thank you Merrell!
customer_reviews.author: S. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a size 7.5 to 8 I bought a size 8 and the fit is perfect. Surprisingly I wear these for showing dogs. They are lightweight and snug to my feet. Definitely a barefoot feel. I don't think I could run in these although they were recommended to me by someone who uses them in marathons
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect shoes for barefoot feel running. Wide toe base for toes to spread out. I Have worn these shoes for a month and they are holding up well with no signs of wear yet. I have suffered from PF and tibial tendionitis for 2 years which made it hard for me to walk much less run. I have spent some much money on shoes and inserts. Who knew that the key to my recovery was to let my feet do what comes natural. Stretching, walking and now running. The muscles in my feet are getting stronger and the pain is slowly decreasing.
customer_reviews.author: susan wrenn

customer_reviews.title: My favorite shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love the feeling of being all but barefoot running or walking. They create a sense of light-footedness and grace. However, if you step on a rock, you'll know it. The upside, these soles (vibram) adhere to any surface so solidly that it makes you feel like you could walk up a wall. I also like that they thin down through the midsection such that I can, with the laces, make my very narrow feet fit this standard medium. I am so sorry this line of shoes has been discontinued. Wouldn't you know!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Running on some bumpy old asphalt was painful for my feet that never go running actually barefoot
customer_reviews.text: As a long-time owner of the old pace glove, the soles on these were very thin and flexible comparatively. You can really feel the ground through these. Running on some bumpy old asphalt was painful for my feet that never go running actually barefoot. Nice wide, soft toe box. My only real criticism is that my feet do get rubbed raw in a couple places. No actual blister after 4 miles, but raw for a couple days. So they're not my go to shoe. This could probably be solved with socks, but that's part of what I like about my pace gloves-no socks required. They seem a touch bigger than my old pace gloves, too.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: It is a very nice shoe but oh boy does it run small. I bought a nine and my niece wears 71/2 and thus she got a present. She is a Zumba instructor. It fit her well. She loves it as it gives her good flexibility and comfort in her classes. Me tho...I have to buy something else. I would recommend you go as much as a size larger if you purchase. 😔
customer_reviews.author: Reese135

customer_reviews.title: Barefoot Beauties
customer_reviews.text: I'm a faithful Merrell wearer, as I love the space in the toe area that allows me to hike, run, bike, etc. without feeling like I'm squishing my feet. These shoes have already gotten me up the hike in Paklenica National Park in Croatia that led to their Manita peć cave... Whiccchhh may not have been a good idea, because these very adequately live up to their qualification as barefoot shoes, and I returned with bruised feet, but! They continue to amaze, are very sturdy, and very flexible, and my favorite, SUPER lightweight for easy travel.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Wide, Roomy, & Super Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This shoe fits true to size. I became interested in it due to having very wide feet. Women's shoes don't typically fit comfortably on me, so I was concerned that Merrell didn't offer a "wide" size. However, the toe box on this shoe is wide and pliable, so your toes are never truly constricted. It's also extremely lightweight-- almost like running in padded socks. It is a true 0mm and offers no cushioning, so expect some adjustment. I took them out for a <2 mile run two days ago and I'm still recovering. My calves are extremely tight. I suggest breaking them in walking around in them first and giving your leg muscles a chance to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: great for biking/running/yoga
customer_reviews.text: Pros: great for biking, great fit, very comfortable to walk in Cons: the laces are way too long (i have to knot them like four times), they look like biking shoes (or workout shoes)...i was hoping these could transition to work or as a casual shoe, but they are so tight on the foot, they almost look like ballerina shoes. The toe box is roomy, have not had blisters from these. I ran in these and it was great. No pain in my left knee. I felt a twig during the first few steps. Wasnt a problem the rest of the run, on trail and on the road. I will be running in these from now on.
customer_reviews.author: d0ubl3ra1nb0w

customer_reviews.title: Like gloves for my feet
customer_reviews.text: I'm a supinator with really high arches so shoes with thick "comfortable" soles throw my balance off. It took years of working long shifts on my feet on hard hospital floors for me to discover what a difference barefoot shoes make. I've tried many brands of minimal shoes over the past 2 years, and these are my favorite so far. I also run in the same shoes I wear for work. I usually wear a 7, 7.5, or 8 as my feet are short, but wide. I purchased size 8 in these and they're perfect. The toe box is very roomy while the heel is tight, no slipping at all. I'm really happy with these!
customer_reviews.author: loralee

customer_reviews.title: Not for me, but maybe they'll suit you.
customer_reviews.text: I loved my Merrell barefoot cross trainers, and desperately looked for another pair once I wore both pairs of those out. This shoe is for running and I need a cross trainer, so maybe it's great for running but I felt like the arch area was a bit narrow and snug, but not in a good way. I found other shoes that felt better for x-training, so these are going back. They were okay, though. I didn't hate them, I just didn't love them either.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Girl

customer_reviews.title: There is nothing there to protect feet from the elements so they're great for people with sweaty feet in the summer
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these shoes I've purchased over the last 5 years. I only got a new pair because I wanted a black shoe. The soles last for years and there in no padding so the shoes stay just as supportive. I don't wear any socks with these and I haven't had any issues with rubbing on my toes or on my heal. They definitely a warmer weather shoe though. There is nothing there to protect feet from the elements so they're great for people with sweaty feet in the summer. One thing to caution though: one of my friends bought the same shoes but had foot cramps because her feet needed more arch support.
customer_reviews.author: mv

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, high quality shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in June of 2017. I love them! I am about to order another pair in a different color. These are my go to athletic shoes! These are extremely comfortable and do not begin to bother my feet after a long day of walking/moving around. I take these on vacation and wear them whenever I’m not working and it’s too cold for flip flops. Great shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Lee

customer_reviews.title: I liked my pace glove 3 trail running shoes so much ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked my pace glove 3 trail running shoes so much I wanted another pair. I decided to get these instead because they have the extra eyelets and a strap to help pull on the shoe. (They are so soft they tend to collapse at the heel.) Because the pace globe 3 was a little short and I had to go up a half size, I did the same with these. That was not necessary as these run a little larger. I do like the shoes but the insole is not as comfortable as that in the glove 3. I cannot use them on trails.
customer_reviews.author: SMarr

customer_reviews.title: These are my second pair!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these shoes. I like to wear them without socks which is super comfy with these but eventually leads to a pervasive stench that cannot be washed out :( My last pair lasted for ~2 years before they started shredding and stinking a little too much. Eventually the fabric on the toe/sides starts to wear apart but seriously I put sooo many miles on these shoes and didn’t hesitate to purchase again. People always compliment me on how “cute” they are too which is hilarious to me because I’m like “NO! THEY’RE FUNCTIONAL” but I end up wearing them a lot with street clothes just because...I do like them :)
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Large toe box, good fit so far!
customer_reviews.text: I have taken more of an interest in the health of my feet lately... teally wanted some 5 finger shoes, but the didn't fit.. the womens seemed too narrow and put pressure accross the bas of the metatarsals. So I went to some stores and tried lots of shoes. I ordered these because of thereviews and they feel really good! I think Im going to like them alot.. ill update as I use them:) I still love these!.. I keep expecting to step on something that will hurt my foot.. but instead I can feel everything... only problem is that now the pain all of my other shoes cause I obvious:/
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Comfort with Merrell's
customer_reviews.text: Although these are listed as "trail running," they seem to fit my foot the same as my other Merrell's: Bare Access Arc 2's and 3's, etc. Lots of toe room and width in the toe box. These do seem to have less cushioning in the sole compared to my other Merrell's, but that is fine with me,. I would describe these shoes as _flat_ if that makes any sense...flat insole, almost bare foot. I love them, as I have an arthritic toe on my right foot, and the flexibility of this shoe material, coupled with the roomy toe area, gives my foot lots of comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Dana L. Beck

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, but falling apart.
customer_reviews.text: Really love these shoes but have to go with two stars due to lack of durability. Incredibly comfortable, very lightweight. Bought them in June and by September the sole is detached in multiple places and the loops on the back are ripping. I've mostly worn them around town and did a couple of small hikes in them, nothing too crazy. I've always loved Merrell's and my previous pairs lasted for years. Not sure if I just got a shotty pair or if maybe their manufacturing practices have changed recently, but likely won't be buying this particular shoe again.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: My favorite shoe for everyday & running!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite shoe. Hands down. It keeps your feet in their natural, healthy state. I wear them as my daily shoe & also as my running shoe! They are super flexible-almost like a dance shoe! Minimalist shoes are the best! They strengthen your feet to be how they are supposed to be naturally! Your feet should support you-not your shoe! Don't baby your feet! Let them be strong! I am usually a size 8.5 but I have a wide foot, so I ordered a size 9 & they fit wonderfully!
customer_reviews.author: morgan

customer_reviews.title: color not as listed/pictured
customer_reviews.text: I wanted shoes I could wear at work. I'm on my feet all day but need to look fairly professional. Black shoes would look fine with black pants and socks and a nice sweater. These are not black/grey, even though that is their listed color. They are greenish blue color. While they are comfortable, they do not fulfill my purpose and I had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: K Bar

customer_reviews.title: Favorite shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes, they're my go to for walking, lifting, hiking. I run and hiked in Vibram FiveFingers for years but couldn't wear socks with them; purchased these for a HIIT class at the gym and fell in love. I wear these to powerlift as well as walk around campus, hiked a couple mountains in them and wore them consistently on my cross country road trip. Overall my favorite shoes (I have three pairs total - snapped them up when Merrell retired them and they went on sale).
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Crowe

customer_reviews.title: " but I enjoy being more engaged mentally during my run anyway
customer_reviews.text: I used to work at a running store and sold shoes for a living. At that time I would never have bought this shoe because I pronate and there is no support in a barefoot shoe! I finally tried this shoe and I will never buy anything else as long as this is available! I have chronic back problems and have always experience plantar and IT band pain...not with these! You have to be very mindful when you run "barefoot," but I enjoy being more engaged mentally during my run anyway. These may not be fore everyone, but they are the only one for me!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I loved these shoes when they arrived
customer_reviews.text: I loved these shoes when they arrived. Great fit. A lot of toe room. Very light weight. I've owned them about 4 months now and ran about 200 miles in them. The soles have held up well but where the shoe creases when I step it has worn very thin. It's sure to be a rip in the next month. So I'm back looking for a new pair of running shoes. One other draw back is because they are bare foot soles they are very thin so you will feel every pebble or crack in the pavement. If you run on a track no problem but many of the roads around me are tar and chip.
customer_reviews.author: R. Berger

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and Good Style
customer_reviews.text: Put these on yesterday morning and went to an event that required me to stand for six hours. I returned home and prepared a large meal which required standing for another two hours. Later in the day, I realized not only were my feet comfortable, leg pain I had been experiencing for some days was non-existent. I am wearing them again today. Absolutely no break-in required by me. Love these shoes! Oh, by the way, I also had complements on their appearance yesterday.
customer_reviews.author: C. D. Goff

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a replacement for another similar pair of Merrell shoes I had own and worn out. These have slightly less padding, which I expected, but they do take some getting used to. The material isn't quite as sturdy as I'd like [my last pair lasted forever] as I'm starting to find holes in the upper material. I purchased these shoes in September so keep in my I've had them now for several months so I can give a full opinion. The color is as expected as is the fitting.
customer_reviews.author: Mara

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful everyday casual shows - love them!
customer_reviews.text: Love them - I’ve had them for over a year and wear them as regular casual shoes. They’ve worn well - performed perfectly and I will order again! I have Jax plantar fasciitis for years and this is the best show I’ve found for this condition. It hasn’t cured it - but hasn’t hurt it either and I believe these shoes strengthen my feet and ankles better than typical shoes with heavy support.
customer_reviews.author: Kannl

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! This is the second pair I've purchased as I have almost worn out the first pair from all the walking I have done in them. Very minimal shoe which allows all of my muscles to work - I think these shoes are the reason I no longer feel the pain of plantar fascitis. The only drawback is they're not good for walking in super cold weather, feet get too cold in these.
customer_reviews.author: Beth A. G.

customer_reviews.title: Poor traction on trails
customer_reviews.text: The fit of the Vapor Glove 2 is great with a flexible sole, wide toe box and good ground feel. However for something advertised as a trail shoe, these have poor traction. I did a test run on a dry trail and the shoes slipped in leaf litter, pine straw, and pebbles. Hills were the worst. If I needed a road shoe I would have kept them for the awesome fit, but I'm sticking to my Vivobarefoot Trail Freaks.
customer_reviews.author: Kellee

customer_reviews.title: My husband bought them for me and I was a little skeptical at first but they are adorable and oh so comfy and they make my feet ...
customer_reviews.text: I am obsessed with these shoes. My husband bought them for me and I was a little skeptical at first but they are adorable and oh so comfy and they make my feet look so petite--just looking at my feet in them makes me happy lol. I work out in them, walk in them and will be taking them to Peru with me next week. They'll pack really well because of how lean they are. Very happy he purchased these for me!
customer_reviews.author: kevin seele

customer_reviews.title: Cool shoe
customer_reviews.text: I run about 3-4 times a week on natural surfaces, either a single-track MTB trail or the perimeter of some hay fields in the winter depending on the season. They are so light, fit swell after using the second eyelet to sung up the back. This is my first experience with minimal running shoes other than the fact that my previous pair were worn very, very, very thin. My calves are sore, but likely from running on toes like you are supposed to. I look forward to wearing them more. I will update if I find a flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Decker

customer_reviews.title: Best. Shoes. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: My feet have a hate relationship with shoes. I do walk on the outside of my feet also which is part of my hate of wearing shoes. I pretty much live in flip flops. However I needed shoes for gym use and I gave these a go. I also purchased 4 other brands to try. These make you feel like you're not wearing shoes at all they aren't cumbersome or stiff and they don't squeeze your feet. However you also feel the support on the bottom of the shoe and it has good grips. It's like an invisible good fitting shoe =] I am excited that I finally found shoes that I can love and not hate.
customer_reviews.author: S.M.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding comfort, extremely light, great looking colors!
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding comfort. If you want to get away from all that cushioning and return to a more natural encasement for your feet, this is a fantastic product. It is so incredibly comfortable and so light it's almost like really going barefoot, but with Vibram outsoles, you are actually very well protected even though you feel intimate contact with the ground. Also, generally I go with muted earth tones, but I really love this colorful shoe (I got the sea blue/coral). Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Bettany

customer_reviews.title: Best minimal running shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Long lasting sole on a minimal running shoe. Build muscles in your feet. Eliminates back, knee and arch problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Would be perfect if toe box was wider.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a minimalist sneaker for walking and these are ok, but I wish the toe box was a tad wider to allow for more toe splay. Not uncomfortable, but not great either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have a love hate relationship with these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have a love hate relationship with these shoes!!! Great fitting and comfortable shoe. However I only wore these shoes several times before they started coming apart at the toes on both shoes. Same thing happened to my daughters shoes. Would be wonderful if the shoe was made as well as the Bare Access shoe. That shoe has hundreds of miles on it and is still in good shape. I like the feel of the Pace better, but I am a serious walker and need a shoe that can handle it. Would buy another if Merrell fixed the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Olstrom

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: I can't really rave enough about these shoes. I wouldn't recommend them to anyone looking for some cushion to their shoe, but I assume if you're looking here you too love barefoot shoes. I got them to go on our annual trip to Disneyland because we put in so many miles there and my feet got super sore last year. Not this year!! And walking on pavement is hardly the best these guys can do. I love waking on rocks and climbing small inclines with these. I can feel everything. I love that! Plus, they are super attractive to me. Again, can't say enough about these!
customer_reviews.author: Harimander Khalsa

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SHOES!
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars only. I love the shoes and I am going to be buying another pair. I used these shoes for a trip to the BWCA and they held up great for water use (accidental) and hiking. The sad thing is that when I got back I washed them in the washing machine and NO DRYER! A friend had washed hers and had no problem. Ever since then they have been coming apart. I tried to contact merrell about this to see if they had heard of this and they said that they would not stand by them.... Going forward I will be buying another pair and not washing them in the washer..
customer_reviews.author: Mgetz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable shoe I have worn in a long time. Fit like a glove. Have done a lot of walking in them and some running- shoes were great right from the start and no blisters or pain. Will definitely be buying more of these. Wonderful shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Bernie Senk

customer_reviews.title: Runs big
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t keep these because they were too big. I’m usually a 10 in any running shoes, including the several pairs of varying style Merrells that I own. The 10 was far too long. These are definitely a minimalistic shoe, very lightweight and little support. They have good protection over the toes, they’re comfy and cute! I hope I can get them in my size!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Kane

customer_reviews.title: Took on Murph like champs
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for CrossFit. I prefer minimal shoes for the WODs, and had been wearing NB Minimus. Had my first pair for 5 years. But my last pair of Minimus bit the dust after maybe 6 months, and not worth the $$$ to take that quality risk again. The Merrells are very comfortable with a wide toe box and mid foot snugness. I just finished Murph wearing them and am very happy with the fit and comfort. Plus such awesome colors! I got the green/purple.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE these shoes! They're durable, reliable and comfortable- Not to mention, uniquely adorable!! This is my 2nd pair of Merrell Vapor Glove's and I get compliments on these all the time. People are always asking me what brand they are and where can they go to get a pair! This time I bought the sea foam color, & they're exactly as they appear in the picture- perfect! I'd size up, at least a half size. However, they do eventually stretch a little.
customer_reviews.author: Heeeha

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes
customer_reviews.text: Best shoes ever, I heard they are discontinuing them so I am trying to buy a few backup pairs. Not just for runners, I work in health care and find these are excellent for being on my feet a while (NO large cushioning). I have been / done the barefoot craze and it worked for me - less knee and hip pain, fewer joint issues, and more mobility. I love these shoes so much, and can hike or walk in them as well as work, so they are versatile! Fit is perfect. Very comfortable and stretchy, like a mesh on the top, and a nice padded sole on the bottom without being too bulky or creating a heel.
customer_reviews.author: LateNightAnarchy

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and functional!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my Merrill Vapor Glove 2 yesterday. I wore them today and they fit great! I noticed that they didn't come with removable insoles. They felt kind of scratchy so I placed some from another pair inside. I like the look, the toe box is wide but not clown shoe wide like other Zero drop heel brands such as Lems. I will use these when I want to do a lot of walking, or at work I bought 10.5 Ladies and they fit fine. I'm not wearing socks.
customer_reviews.author: Leilas

customer_reviews.title: These are not running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered one size up because the size chart was confusing and they are somewhat big. So, my first advice - order your real size. My second advice - if you need real running shoes, don't buy these ones, they are good for walking - very light and very flexible, but not for running. There is absolutely no arch support, the sole is extremely thin, even for walking I need an additional cushion because the shoes are too flat. I wanted minimalist running shoes, but I am a bit disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Narrow, order up
customer_reviews.text: This was mostly exactly what I was looking for. Zero drop shoes that look normal for working out or everyday use. I ordered a 9 although I usually wear an 8 1/2 because my last merrells were a bit tight. These are better but still a little tighter than I'd like in the toe box. I don't want to go bigger because then they'd be too long. I was hoping to wear sox with them but there's no room for that. :/
customer_reviews.author: RedRam

customer_reviews.title: Great minimal shoe
customer_reviews.text: Tighten the laces and these things fit like a glove! I have narrow feet and love Merrells for their narrower fit. If you truly trail run in these your form and foot placement need to be on point. They will protect your skin from sharp little things and slug ick, but will not really protect your from rocks, larger roots or otherwise give you support. These are on the "barefoot running" end of the shoe spectrum.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fortune

customer_reviews.title: Nice Looking and They Feel Great
customer_reviews.text: I love Merrels. It is so difficult to find other shoes that fit well, are true to size, have the comfort, design, and structure of a Merrel shoe. I've given up trying. This she in particular is roomy in the toe box and has great air flow. The sole reminds me of my last pair of Vibram five fingers, which is just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Beryl

customer_reviews.title: Give them a try!!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. I wasn't sure about the fit as these are different from my last Merrells, but the 8.5 was perfect. I don't often order online but I was so happy that these turned out so well. I feel great contact with the ground in every step - and they kept me going for a really long convention with almost no foot pain at all. I really recommend trying these! Make the step towards strong feet! NOTE: if you're looking for a shoe with super padded arch support... stop! I have high arches and there's nothing better that you can do for your feet than to make them stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Hill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent minimalist shoes for a narrow foot
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace an older pair of Merrell barefoot shoes. I like the fact there is no elastic at the heel, which is a better design. They're ultra light and offer the full barefoot experience. Meaning no padding, no arch support, just some contour vibram rubber between your foot and the ground. They do run narrow as I normally wear a narrow and did not have to do a lot of snuggling to get them to fit. No blistering or break in period. I think these are better than the pair they replaced.
customer_reviews.author: N'boots

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: I'm satisfied with these shoes. I'm not overjoyed or estatic just satisfied. The soles are hard and durable enough that I don't feel every pebble or stick...good. what irritates me though is that the tongue won't stay in the middle and the shoelaces loosen or come untied all together. Would I buy them again? Yes because they at least get the job done
customer_reviews.author: Xena

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes so much
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes so much. I used to always wear New Balance Minimus, but the new version of them is not as good as the old version, so I had to find something new. These are a little lighter weight and more flexible, but I like them that way. They are very comfy. I wear an 8 in most shoes and bought an 8 and they fit great. Have been wearing them for about 6 months now for running and working out.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, very thin and light. One shoe weighed in at only 5.3 oz. Definitely the polar opposite of those bulky, cushy clodhoppers that are so popular these days. Your feet are sensors and need to be able to feel the ground when you walk. These allow that. The Liberty color has super bright neon orange trim which isn't what I was expecting, but color aside, this is a great everyday/workout shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Lionheart

customer_reviews.title: I love the Merrell low profile shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love the Merrell low profile shoes. I have 2 pairs of this new model and 5 pairs of the previous model. The only worry I have of this new model is they have loops instead of eyes for the laces and I yank pretty hard when tightening up my laces. I'm afraid I might break one of the loops. I hope they make a few more colors.
customer_reviews.author: mobetta

customer_reviews.title: Great for every day if that's what you need.
customer_reviews.text: I like running, but my feet don't. However, I've come to love wearing barefoot running shoes to work. As a teacher, I'm on my feet all day and dress shoes pinch or hinder my natural posture. I've had great success with the minimus line, but tried these because they blend a littlest better with dress pants and were a better price point. I could not be happier! They have the right blanace of natural weight distribution and foot protection and manage to be cute as well. They even make my feet look a size small due to having well tailored lines. I will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: C. D. Baut

customer_reviews.title: they were a good substitute. I love how lightweight and flexible they ...
customer_reviews.text: Although these are slightly different than my beloved 5 year old Merrells (pace gloves), they were a good substitute. I love how lightweight and flexible they are. I would like to see these offered in a few more colors, but besides that I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: S. D. Huddleston

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Vapor!
customer_reviews.text: It's extremely comfortable and fits true to size. I wear these until they are worn out and then replace them with the same shoe. I've tried other Merrell Vapors, but the Vapor 2 is my favorite!
customer_reviews.author: Judy Kepler

customer_reviews.title: Loved the original Vapor Glove, expect to love the 2 as well
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, the original Merrell Women's Vapor Glove is one of the best minimalist/barefoot shoes made. Since that is no longer available, this is a close second. Very good ground feel. Very happy with the originals that I've worn for 2 years. Actually, I recently broke my toe and those were the only shoes I wore for 6 straight weeks...we'll see how the Vapor Glove 2 compares over time. I expect similarly, as my approval is highly related to the sole, which appears the same
customer_reviews.author: Carrie AM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for barefoot, minimalist edperienced runners
customer_reviews.text: I love this shoe.traction, fit...A+, please be sure you understand, practice proper form when running to get the most out of the barefoot experience, and avoid injuries. I'm a huge fan of the benefits of barefoot, minimalist running...it takes time,practice to achieve optimal performance but we'll worth the physical, muscle, powerful improvements in body overall running experience and growth
customer_reviews.author: Kristie

customer_reviews.title: Merrell Trail Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I was leery of these shoes at first and only wore them about 4 hours the first day. But the next day I wore them all day and my legs and feet felt somewhat tired. But the day after that (I wore regular shoes again) I was amazed at how strong my feet felt and my balance had even improved. I could stand on one foot at a time for quite a while without wobbling. I am amazed at these shoes and will keep wearing them. My son-in-law is a fabulous runner and he wears them for running quite a bit. He thinks they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to workout in. They are exactly what I wanted, a lightweight comfortable fit that would allow me to feel the ground under my feet when working out. My feet probate, in in other shoes I'd feel like I was practicing proper alignment when lifting only to look down and see my foot twisted in my sneaker and not not aligned at all. These shoes have eliminated that problem. I am very happy with my decision to switch to these minimal sneaker to workout in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love them! Can't wait to put them on
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing this model as my main shoe for several years. I love the flexibility and support of the arch from the molded vibram sole. I was worried at first that it would not give me the support that I needed, but I am converted to the barefoot feel. My knees and ankles are better than they have been in the past. It did take a little bit to get used to the change, but this is my 5th pair. My only comment about this pair is that it seems just a hair shorter than the others of the same size.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Surpassed my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I was having a lot of trouble with plantar fasciitis. It has been off and on for about four months. A friend suggested I try these shoes as they would allow more mobility in my feet compared to rigid shoes. I actually do 24 feet exercises a day (it takes an hour) to deal with the plantar fasciitis. I was very skeptical that the shoes would make a difference, but I find that I just love these shoes and have stopped wearing anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wellens

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: So, yeah, they are thin, reminiscent of water shoes. But I love that they are legit barefoot, ultra thin flexible sole but does NOT hurt while running.I love how light they are. I don't ever go more than 3 miles at a time but so far, after two months, holding up fine.
customer_reviews.author: should be doing laundry

customer_reviews.title: disappointed. Poor design.
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of Merrell "glove shoes" that I love. I thought these would be the same, but I was wrong. There is a bump inside the shoe where the laces are attached that rubs against my bone. I don't have bunions, and I don't want to develop any, so I cut a hole in the side of shoe to stop the pressure and rubbing. They should not have placed that bump there. I was disappointed to have to do this, but I just wear them for walking on my treadmill.
customer_reviews.author: JudyVB

customer_reviews.title: Great minimalist shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes after they were recommended for weightlifting. I can tell the difference in my posture when I'm lifting - the running shoes I was previously lifting in were causing my ankles to want to roll. These are the next best thing to barefoot. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S.

customer_reviews.title: Tad Small
customer_reviews.text: with is perfect. I have wide feet and for this reason I love this brand/style of shoe. I usually get Merrell Vapor Glove style for running shoes, but it runs just a tad small. Usually after worn a while they stretch where it doesn't matter, but this particular shoe had not. Wish I could have gone up 1/2 size, I think a full size up would have been too much.
customer_reviews.author: Drea

customer_reviews.title: It is really just the next best thing to being completely barefooted
customer_reviews.text: The point of these shoes is NOT arch support. It is really just the next best thing to being completely barefooted! The point of minimalist shoes is to enable the tiny little muscles all throughout our feet to do the job that they are prevented from doing by wearing stiff shoes and force our heels to hit the pavement first. Read these books: Born to Run, Move Your DNA, and even The Brain that Changes Itself, and then you will understand.
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are a different experience
customer_reviews.text: When I bought these shoes there was a tool that helped me figure out my size and it really worked. I am a 7 and ordered 7. I have bought other merrell shoes and sometimes they're one size higher but these fit as expected. These shoes are a different experience. They are very light and when you run in the treadmill with them, you can feel your heel touching the surface. You use different muscles and in general I like them a lot. You become more conscious of your body and you walk and run differently.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Azahar

customer_reviews.title: ... second pair of Merrel Barefoot shoes and I absolutely love them!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Merrel Barefoot shoes and I absolutely love them!!! I wish they had more colors in my size!! I wear them to run in and have no complaints. If you plan on doing the same, however, keep in mind that when they say barefoot they mean barefoot. It's like running in socks so they provide very little protection against rocks and other sharp objects.
customer_reviews.author: Susan E.

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. However, they've now been replaced with one or two newer versions. I bought a second pair of these just so I'd have a spare since this Vapor Glove 2 version won't be available much longer.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: SO lightweight and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My favorite athletic shoe now! So light and comfortable as soon as I put it on. I have a wider foot and these were perfect. Not for walking on rocks, as the sole is very thin and flexible, you can feel everything. But in my day to day smooth floor activities, this will be a go-to shoe!
customer_reviews.author: Mitzi

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: Got a size 5. I am usually a 5-5.5, medium width. After trying these shoes on I found out that my left foot is longer than my right foot. The shoe fit perfectly on my right foot but was pretty tight on the left. After 2-3 days the left shoe stretched a little and now they fit great. I use those when I lift weights, run on the treadmill, walk outside... They are very comfortable and actually protect your feet when you step on gravel or rocks, so a bit less barefoot-y that I expected (in a good way). :P
customer_reviews.author: xelakitten

customer_reviews.title: I have loved every pair of Merrill shoes I have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: I have loved every pair of Merrill shoes I have ever bought.....except these. The fabric material is cheap and started thinning out as others have complained about. Holes formed as a result and these sneakers had to be tossed within 6 months-I really should have thrown them out after 3 months. I had bought these shoes specifically for work as I stand on my feet for 12 hours inside, and the barefoot style works best for me. It was upsetting to me that they had basically no outdoor wear and tear and they fell apart so quickly. Would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for running/walking
customer_reviews.text: As with all of my previous Merrell shoes, these were comfortable out of the box. I wore them this morning for the first time and they were great. I did buy a half size up because I like a bit of room. The fit is good. I won't wear them all day because I want to use them primarily for running. I do have an old pair of Pace gloves that I use for everyday now. I am amazed at how consistently good Merrell shoes are. I would purchase these again without a doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Rita P.

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes. I am glad I bought them. I have to position the tongue of the right shoe slightly to the left instead of centering it, to protect a place where the construction of the shoe rubs on my foot. I would suggest that they make the tongue slightly wider across to correct this issue. Very light weight and easy to wear and put on. Thank you for a nice shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Cloudhelix

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought the arch support on these was a bit aggressive and formed for a "minimalist" shoe, but I quickly got accustomed to it. I might buy a second pair as I learned my lesson after my old New Balance Minimus bit the dust. Now NB has a super molded arch support in their new ones. I wear between a 9 and a 9.5 and I preferred the 9.5 to fit in socks.
customer_reviews.author: D. Krueger

customer_reviews.title: True to size. Very comfy
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing merrells for years now and they are pretty true to size. While these don't have as much support as some of the other styles, I still enjoy them. I got the castle rock but please note they are a bit greenish, not all black. I still like them but didn't realize they were a deeper dark green hue.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Blake

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Love the feel of the fit. Hugs my feet and I can feel where I'm stepping. This helps me to not stumble as much. Also I have a desk job and usually sit with my legs crossed up in the chair. With regular soled shoe the sole would dig into my leg. These shoes are so flexible it almost feels like I'm not wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Jana Bowen

product_meta.title: Merrell Vapor Glove 2
product_meta.description: This featherlight trail shoe liberates your run with zero-drop ground contact. The breathable mesh upper molds to your foot for an uninhibited stride.
feature_bullets: Barefoot-style trail runner in mesh and TPU with traditional lace closure, breathable mesh lining, and integrated microfiber soft footbed
Wash as needed in cold water, gentle cycle and air dry
